data.title: Potential Switch Port Round-Up - The Wii U Games That Haven't Come To Switch
meta_keywords: The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess HD
The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker HD
data.meta_description: Want that one - Back in 2020 we asked you in a poll which games you'd most like to see return from Nintendo's previous console generation for an encore on Sw...

Paraka

@the4seer - Well, on top of that, someone made a good point why ports are becoming more and more common place.

Making new games take time, and more of it each passing generation. That eats up money and consumer awareness, no one wants to buy a system and feel "ignored" all the time. Nintendo fans know this pretty well.

So in making ports, they serve multiple, business-oriented purposes.

1) Keep the public eye on them, constantly announcing "new to you" ports and new games alike they can keep people talking about them (even if it's complaints of Wii U owners).

2) Creates fillers to the gap of releases, keeping something relatively new and available to play on the go, some may not be you, but there is always enough people who aren't you to be worth it.

3) Fund new projects further, there is a reason Metroid Prime 4 can be affordable to delay and develop it to completion. And a reason Nintendo can release bunk sometimes (Sushi Striker, Flip Wars) and continue to do so.

It's all good business strategy period to do this. And is a clear reason many third parties abuse the ever-loving crap out of it.

And honestly, if more people got to play Endless Ocean or NES Remix through a port, the more likely I get a sequel.

@dewokkel I have "Zombie Army Trilogy" for the Switch. So there's that. I have fun with that game. Basically just "Sniper Elite with zombies", if you've never played it. But yeah, I loved ZombiU. I played it a lot, and beat it multiple times. It's a shame that it was rushed. It was originally revealed to be alien invasion game, but the aliens were too small and hard to hit, so, they changed it to zombies instead, right before E3 that year and basically started over from scratch. But, they desperately wanted it to be a launch title, so that they could say that they had the "first must have title" on the Wii U. But because they changed concepts so late in the process, they didn't have time to do everything that they wanted. Nintendo planned on Pikmin 3 being a launch title but, they knew it wasn't ready, so they pushed it back, and it didn't release until August the next year. But, Ubisoft refused to push back ZombiU to properly finish it, and thus, had to cut things. They cut the multiplayer aspect down, and cut out some weapons, and some levels, and other things, and said that they would put those in the sequel instead of trying to put them in the first game, as planned. But, because they rushed the game, and refused to push it back finish it, because they were so dead set on it being a launch title, the game wasn't all it could of been. Which is a shame, because it was still a good game, that I had lots of fun with. But extra time working on it could of made it so much better. But, because it was incomplete when it released, it didn't sell well, and then the sequel got cancelled because of it. Which is a shame. But it would be nice if they Remastered ZombiU for the Switch (tho, the title would just have to be "Zombi" like the other consoles, as the U wouldn't make sense, and you obviously can't use the "tch" from the end of "Switch", as Zombi ends in "bi", and, that would just be bad if they named it that, for obvious reasons). But yeah, a full remaster of the game, with, hopefully, the extra stuff that they didn't have time to complete the first time around, would be great. I'd love to play the game again, on the Switch, if they did that.

In the end, it's all a matter of perspective, for a gamer. Although, it's hard to ignore the scenario that Nintendo is essentially just trying to "break even" with certain WiiU titles. I'm almost certain that if the trend was porting/remaking/remastering/ "deluxing" older games from more successful systems, there would be much more excitement (i.e. Link's Awakening and Xenoblade).
